intro: Pilosella kalksburgensis subsp. melanopolia, commonly known as the Kalksburg pilosella, is a flowering plant native to specific regions in Europe. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads. The subspecies is distinguished by its dark brown to blackish stems and leaves, which set it apart from other pilosella species. It typically grows in rocky or sandy soils, often in alpine or subalpine environments. The plant produces small, yellowish flowers that bloom in the summer months.
